Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Summer188
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast. We were given a room on the 2nd floor. I purchased the hotel with my air ticket so I was not able to get Hilton HHonors points. The location was good, close to freeways, shopping and food. I was told at check-in that there would be window washing that day. After we had settled in, we heard loud noise and a man was at the window looking at us as he begin to wash it. Not a big problem because I would want a clean window, so we shut the curtain. The view, however, was a rooftop. It was a very noisy room, however, because our room was right next to the gym (banging which I think were the weights in the gym). I called the front desk to complain because it was late at night. The following day, we were gone most of the day. We returned at 3:30 to find that the room had not been cleaned yet. At 3:45 we got a knock on the door from housekeeping who was now ready to clean our room. It was good for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Abcdefgdddjsj
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Mission Valley is one of the best places I've stayed. From the moment you pull up, the staff is very professional, friendly and always willing to help. The rooms are always clean and spacious. Very comfortable beds as well. Good location to freeway access; wether you want to head to the beaches, old town, downtown, east county, etc. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kardex2dog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Mission Valley Hotel with my husband for a yearly convention always held in Southern California. The front desk staff and bell staff were very helpful as we arrived early and rooms were not quite ready. They stored luggage, rang me up on my cell phone when the room was ready. Room was large and nice flat screen tv -- overlooking a garden (which was what I had requested). They didn't tell us that it was upstairs on the second floor with no elevator but we managed. We used the tennis courts during our free time and it was really nice watching the sea gulls perched on the tennis court lights as though criticizing my play. The conference facilities were very nice and the room kept at a comfortable temperature. I would stay here with my husband for a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “this place aims to please”
Reviews.Author: ezdraft
Reviews.Content: i was lucky enough to get this hotel via one of those blind bid travel websites. They were fast at checkin, very helpful and the place is so nice, the bed is firm, plenty of pillows. I asked for towels because my daughter used all the towels and in minutes they brought 2 more sets of towels. Easy checkout too.

Reviews.Title: “Not my typical hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business after being at another hilton the night before. Proprty seemed run down and myself and my co workers in different floors all noticed a lot of noise during the night. I agree with another review that other lower cost hotels have been better.

Reviews.Title: “I think i would have had a better stay at a lower budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Christy W
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and the pillows and bedding were better than normal, but that is all I can say nicely. When you take the elevator from the parking garage to the lobby it reeks of cigarettes, I got the spare blanket and it had a rice crispy cereal stuck to it, and i can't believe that a hotel like this doesn't have a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “this is a Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: twincitiesvac
Reviews.Content: First off the staff were super from check in to trying to connect to the wifi. the room on the other hand needs some help the walls are PAPER thin it was hard to hear the noise from the "city view" freeway noise because of the conversation between a mother and daughter and it was at normal speaking level next door or the couple on the other side. the room had no mini bar or mini refrigerator. the room did have a nice amount of space and was clean and well maintained but not very many amenities in it either.the king size bed was nice and the pillows comfy. The parking lot is not well lighted small spaces and bad layout and at 16 dollars a day in this part of town really? it does have a great location to access the freeways of San Diego over all underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Travel to and from airport expensive”
Reviews.Author: 123barrister
Reviews.Content: Travel by cab for 7 miles and 10 minutes was $30. The Blue shuttle was $12 if you could get it. Parking at the Hotel was $16 per day. There is an Enterprise rental car office about a quarter mile from the Hotel. Parking plus airport rental rates makes renting after you get to the Hotel a much better option if you don't need the car every day. The Hotel was a good place for a big meeting with lots of space to get together outside the meeting rooms. there are food options in the Hotel and all around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Business friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 20 people staying at the Hilton for a 3 month period. The sales staff really worked with us to accommodate our special needs! Always friendly, professional. The rooms are updated and comfortable. It is a great central location. Every store you could imagine is close. I would recommend any group check this hotel out!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: From the moment i walk in the stay was great. I walk in at about 3pm and the staff welcomed me with a warm smile, right to the counter. Check in was very fast. When i get in the room the lay out was nice . STD King . I had a view looking over the city. The bed was nice but the best part was the pillows, six of them on the bed and one more in the closet. Not that you would need more then one . Usa today at the door every morning. All in all great stay great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money-Good location”
Reviews.Author: JB072
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our trip to the USA last year - pregnancy, study and a baby have delayed my review until now! We booked the room just a few days out of arriving in San Diego and whilst this place is out of the main SD area - we had a hire car and wanted to see the city anyway - so it made no difference. Checkin was great and the car was taken care of stright away. NOt all of the valet parking is undercover, but we had no issues. The room was a good size, blockout blinds and the bathroon was functional and clean. We had room servie the first night as we'd driven from LA late in the day and the only downside to this was the lack of larger table in the roon on which to eat. The food was fast and good qualiity. The location of the hotel seems a bit out of the way until you realise there is a large mall over the freeway (easily accessed via walking the path out of the hotel and up tot he right) as well as several other restuarants such a Hooters and other pub-style food. There were a few people living roough in the area, which we came to get used to after a few weeks in the USA, but they were no problem and we walked to and fron the htoel and shopping. eating area daily and at night without incident.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: Jacalix
Reviews.Content: My husband stays here probably 8-10 times a year on business. I decided to tag along n this trip and I am disappointed. He is a Hilton diamond member and this hotel is not up to the standard of a lot of Hiltons...maybe a Hilton Garden Inn or the like. Rooms are run down to sat the least. Doors are peeling, cabinets are peeling, floors are stained, elevators shake, decor is old and dated in rooms. I took time to read reviews and a new T.V does not make up for any of this for me. Beds are not comfortable either which does matter. Cleaning people stood outside our room for 20-30 mins this am and talked to point where I could hear them over traffic. Unfortunately I have another 3 nights here while my husband has business. If it wasn't a work contracted hotel I would be gone :( He also now realizes that he will be asking for other approval elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sally D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for business 3 times and each time everyone was amazing.The restaurant could use a little variety for dinner but it's really easy to get here from the airport if you're traveling for business. The hallways near the elevators need to cleaned a little but overall very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hilton Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: pbpetlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a little getaway - we live in San Diego. Check in was very quick and we were even able to check in early. The room and pool/jacuzzi area were both very nice. We really had a great time and the staff was very pleasant. Plenty within walking distance for eating options. All in all it turned out to be a great place to just kick back and relax!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Bunners55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a supercross event, even the maid was extremely friendly! When we checked in they were really friendly and helpful to change our rooms around to accommodate last minute reservations. I really recommend staying here whenever your in the mission valley area! Hector the general manager ROCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: Great location in mission valley. Must pay for parking. very nice comfortable bed. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: familyvacation3
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I was a little nervous about what to expect. We checked in after 8 pm so our room was ready, the front desk staff was more than helpful, all were very nice. The first night a king room was not available, so we had a double bed room on the back side of the hotel facing the hill. Very quiet, room was nice. The next day we moved to a king bed room on the front side facing the highway, which really wasn't a big deal. You could hear the highway noise, but unless an emergency vehicle with sirens blarring went by (which only happened once), we really didn't notice the noise. Yes the location is congested, be easy enough to maneuver. We walked to the trolley station located on the far side of the mall and didn't have any problem - all intersections have crosswalks, area seemed safe enough. The room was clean, maid service was great, (and seemed shocked when we told her she didn't need to clean our room one day), coffee maker in the room and fridge in the king room. I only gave this hotel an average rating because the most annoying thing to us was that they charged you daily to use internet service in your room, or you could sit in the lobby and use the wi-fi for free! Sitting in the lobby didn't bother us, so we did. They also have an office set up with computers and a printer that you can use free of charge, which was helpful the few times we needed to print a document. Overall our stay was nice. The hotel staff, whether the front desk, maids, concierge, whomever, were all very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sportsinfo101
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice experience at this property. Have stayed here once before a few years ago and came back for a short weekend visit. Room was nice, staff pleasant and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mholi
Reviews.Content: I recently visited this hotel on a business trip. I arrived at the hotel at 3:30 and my room was not available. Check in at this hotel is 4pm. The front desk staff was helpful and gave me another room within 10 minutes. I would suggest requesting a high floor since the lower floors are a little noisier due to the highway. My room was on the 10th floor so I did not hear any noise. The room was decent. The bed was ok but not as comfortable as most hiltons and the room tempature was hard to regulate. It would not get cold. There is no executive lounge so the hotel offers you breakfast ( nothing to write home about) and a non alcoholic beverage and an appetizer ( limited menu). I wasn't wowed by the food but the staff was nice. The location is great since it is right across the street from the Westfield Mall and 1 minute away from the highway which was great. I usually stay at the Westin Downtown but decided to try a different hotel. Overall it was a decent hotel in a good location if you need highway access. I would stay again if the rate was lower. Otherwise, I would rather pay for a hotel more reminiscent of the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Lower Version of Hilton”
Reviews.Author: coosbaygal
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is far less than the regular Hilton named hotels. It was located in a very congested area, hard to get to and lacked the fine appeal that Hilton's normally give you. The wrose thing was that the breakfast trays from room service where outside of the rooms all day into the six o'clock hour of the evening, this is disgusting and not very hygenic.The price is lower than the other Hiltons in San Diego. The quality of the hotel is lower budget. I stayed here for a workshop and the hotel was cold, small and the service was slow. The parking sucks, it has small and tight spaces and they charge you 16 dollars a day for the parking. There is street parking for free, and some better hotels nearby. Whatever you do don't stay on the 2nd floor, because they hold workshops on this floor and it will be very crowded and noisey. The restaurant can not accomodate large crowds, it will take over 30 minutes to get your food, when they are busy. the restaurant was very cold so bring your jacket. The signal on the TV was lost and I had to have someone come to the room to fix it, it did appear that this has happened before since he knew exactly what to do to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, well priced”
Reviews.Author: Kardenham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Christmas Eve. We got a great deal with name your own price from Priceline.com. Rooms were very clean, comfortable bed, good pillows. It was convenient to other areas of San Diego. Perfect for a business traveler. Wanted to use the pool, but it was not heated. Lobby rather cold, I think mainly designed to have you check in and go immediately to your room. Great, if you just want to relax in your room or want to get some work done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hilton as always”
Reviews.Author: Nitroxprt
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hilton Property several time a year, and find it is always up to standards of the Hilton Family. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and customer service oriented. The food service in the bar/restaurant has always been excellent as has the food. (Note to buffet breakfast food service mgr. I know it is difficult to keep food hot for an extended period of time, but the eggs, potatoes, and sometimes the breakfast meats are lukewarm, not hot.) The breakfast buffet has a variety of hot and cold breakfast items. The rooms (s) have always been clean, neat, well organized and have upgraded flat screen televisions. There are plenty of outlets for computer, phone, iPad etc, and the reading light on the nightstand is bright enough to actually read a book by!!! The hotel is located near a major shopping center/retail area with numerous choices for dining/entertainment/and shopping. The hotel is also close to downtown and Old Town San Diego. This is an excellent Hilton that I will stay at again, and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grnwayrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a room facing the freeway, bonus was a sidelong view of the Pacific a few miles away. Despite the traffic wizzing by, never heard anything in the room. Mission Valley is within a 15 minute drive of downtown, the airport, Balboa Park, La Jolla, and Sea World. Was lucky enough to have booked a rate that included parking, I think $16 is a bit steep for what is basically a suburban location.The room is nicely furnished, and the bathroom towels were very large and fluffy. Water pressure in the shower is weak due to water saving showerheads. The entire hotel was very clean, and we never waited long for an elevator. My only issue was that at check-in there were no rooms available even at 3:45 in the afternoon. Was made to wait in the lobby for appx. 30 minutes despite having HHoners elite status. The front desk even tried to say check in time was not until 4pm, though on my confirmation e-mail from Hilton it is listed as 3.

Reviews.Title: “Why paid parking?”
Reviews.Author: David293922
Reviews.Content: The room and the lobby were quite adequate. As many noted before, the elevators were very slow and non-responsive. The best feature was the pool and jacuzzi in the back of the property with a view of an overlooking hillside. Everything kept up great there by the staff (towels and cleanliness) and it added a nice tranquility. The item that put a bee under my bonnet, metaphorically and in old-timey phrasalogy), was the additional cost of parking there. $16. Besides Crowne Plaza down the road, I'm not aware of any other hotels in that area that tack on such an additional charge. There were quite a number of Asian guests there, which it probably didn't bother as much as me, since that is the norm in their countries, and is to be expected. Thank goodness for other tripadvisor reviewers that shared the secret to park on the street in front of the AM/PM gas station. But that is half a block away, and has only three spaces in front of it, and two of them are usually taken up by gypsy cab companies. And yes, I'd proudly cheap enough for this to rankle me. It's not as if the Hilton family is hurting, and Heaven knows I'd hate to deny any of the Hiltons their multi-million dollar bonuses at the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: JackAndJohn
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, super clean, and we could walk to the trolley station and easily get to Old Town/Downtown. Very good service, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Mission Valley, San Diego, California”
Reviews.Author: Thayne C
Reviews.Content: Great place and very convenient access to multiple places. Valet service (Hunter) was outstanding! Very quiet considering the location is next to a major interstate. Only, ding; housekeeping service failed to provide washcloths for our last night. Room was very clean and king bed was comfortable. Priceline got us a great room at a great price. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: Hilton honors member on a long trip, late arrival at this property. Alex and William at the front desk were waiting on my arrival having been notified by Hilton reservations. Bottle water, excellent room, pickup reservations for arriving family the next day. Over and above! Thanks guys, super job.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay if you are always running around.”
Reviews.Author: Daren C
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed in this Hilton over the Holidays. It was close to the Zoo, and Sea World and the beaches. The Room Service was excellent and the server was very pleasant and helpful. The price was a good deal and so we did not get a room with a view because we were always running around seeing relatives, shopping, and going to tourist attractions. The issue I have is the consistency with the internet and parking at each site. They also wanted me to put a deposit down when I have not had to do this at any other Hilton site before. We did have a good time seeing friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a little bit far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: Claudio-1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel during a meeting. They had a shopping center and some restaurants around, but to go to downtown you pay at least U$ 25.00 in a cab. But if you have your own car, the hotel is OK and also the location. Its clean, nice, and the employees very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hilton Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Cami B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the Christmas holiday and I want to point out that I always stay at a Hilton property and never have I been so disappointed. If customer service is important, I would not recommend anyone stay here. On Christmas day and also my birthday (4:30am) my toilet was stopped up, I called the front desk and a security guard showed up with a plunger. I was told that maintenance would not be in until later that morning. I tried to unstop the toilet and it end up overflowing. I then called back down to the front desk and told them that it was overflowing and again security showed up with towels, dawn and some spic and span. I called down again and ask for the manager and express my disappointment with the way this were being handled and the fact that he (the manager) had not spoken to me or come up to address the situation. The manager did come up after that and told me he would refund my stay. On Christmas morning I spent the day cleaning up a mess that should have been done by the hotel. I also left my email address for the general manager Hector to contact me but I have yet to hear from him or anyone else. I am not one to post rant reviews however this is one everyone needs to read.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Dated Facility”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Mission Valley is a mixed bag. Front desk staff were exceptional during my stay, and the hotel was conveniently located near events I attended over the holiday period. However, it is a dated facility in desperate need of room and HVAC upgrades. There is no fresh air in the rooms, and the A/C unit completely dried out my sinuses. The bed is comfy, and the desk gets the job done, but the wicker chair needs to go. Wicker, really?! There is a nice flat-screen TV that rotates for easy viewing, but the on-screen navigation leaves something to be desired. The gym is underwhelming, although clean, and the outdoor pool is too small for proper swimming. The Jacuzzi is nice, if not a bit small. There was so much chlorine in the water that I had to wash my hair twice after swimming to get it out. The lobby area is attractive, and the Christmas tree was tastefully decorated. In terms of value for money, the Hilton does not offer free wi-fi or breakfast, and it charges an outrageous $16 per night for parking despite its suburban location. Do yourself a favor and park on the street for free to keep costs down. Friends that visited during my stay were not impressed with the hotel, specifically citing the lack of niceness they expect from a property with the Hilton name. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to others, but it's an okay place if you get a good deal through a name-your-own-price website.

Reviews.Title: “Location is always a plus”
Reviews.Author: May C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick 3days Christmas getaways with the kids. Amazing location from San Diego Zoo, Sea World, down town. There's also nearby restaurants to choose from if you dont want to eat in the hotel. The staff from the front desk, the bell man, housekeeping were very courteous. Always had that smile that welcomes you back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was full of rowdy rugby players, but still a good time”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: When I stayed there the hotel was packed with rugby teams competing in a tournament. It was highly entertaining. Not especially quiet, but a whole lot of fun. I was part of a work group that wasn't especially quiet either. Let's just say we had a very fun Friday and Saturday in the hotel and surrounding establishments and we were all far more subdued on Sunday. We got a good rate and was a pleasant place to spend the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a disappointment -manager does not care”
Reviews.Author: profshanku
Reviews.Content: Had to stay in this hotel due to participation in a conference. Reservation was made through my company's travel department. Check-in was quick and was given a room on the Executive floor. This hotel does not have an Executive lounge, so was given breakfast coupons as well as appetizer/drinks coupons. The room was a corner room but small. It was cold when I walked into the room at 6:30 in the evening. By 10:00, the thermostat refused to go above 64F even though I had bumped it to 75F!!! Finally called the front desk to find out if I was doing something wrong. They sent an engineer (after two calls) who came in with all his tools, took down the vent cover and spent the next 10-15 minutes fixing whatever was wrong. Thankfully the heater came on and I did not have to change rooms. Next morning there was no hot water in the shower. Considering that I was in town on business, I did not want to waste time. So after a cold shower in December, went down for breakfast. And then I had the worst experience - hair in my bowl of freshly cut strawberries. Over the last six years I have stayed exclusively at Hilton properties all over the world and this has never happened to me. It was absolutely disgusting. I went to the front desk in order to notify someone of all the issues that I was having. The gentleman showed no interest in listening to what I had to say - instead he handed me one of the standard Hilton Compliment cards/form. When I expressed my surprise, he said - "Compliments or complaints - all in the same form". Filled it out and dropped it off at the front desk. No one contacted me during the day. Next morning, received another "we aim to be the best and want to get a 10 on the survey" form from manager. It specifically said that if I had problems, I should contact him PRIOR to check-out. I wrote my email address on the form along with a brief note stating that I had submitted a complaint form and dropped it off at the desk. Checked out several hours after that and still did not hear back from the manager. The strange thing is that I did not receive any "survey" from the property either. Which makes me think that the staff reads the comments but they don't care. Anyways, there are several other Hilton properties in San Diego with better locations and better service. Please read the other reviews on Tripadvisor before making a reservation at this hotel and use this hotel only as a last resort. All I can say is that some properties don't deserve to carry the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Well run and dependable Hilton property.”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to low rate over Thanksgiving, but the location across from the Mission Valley shopping was a nice plus. This is not a luxuriuous Hilton, and doesn't try to come across as such. I can see why business people stretched for time would stay here as the staff knows what it is doing and there are no surprises. The room was well kept and comfortable, furnished nicely. The lighting was good for reading, the bed was comfortable and the HVAC was quiet and worked well. Bathroom was not huge but it was clean with plenty of hot water. The business center was excellent which is unusual. The web access was speedy and the printers worked. We didnt use any of the recreational facilities. The breakfast buffet was very good and free for Honors members. The parking fee is aggravating but all the hotels in this area charge for it. There is a fancy, full service Doubletree nearby that may be more luxurious, and a Doubletree Club about a mile that is often cheaper. This is the better alternative if you can get the same or lower rate. There is no Honors floor at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a treat to be able to use the meeting room for fellowship”
Reviews.Author: OLIVER3388
Reviews.Content: We are grateful that the arrangement by the hotel manager. The stay is superb, The rooms are clean and quiet with our double bed rooms facing the hill. Convieniently located close to many of our destinations (La Jolla, Torrey pine, Cabrillo and Balboa park), this hotel is really our best choice. The staffs are friendly and helpful. If there is anything I would ask for more, I would like to have more selections in the breakfast buffet. Overall, I would recommend without hesitation for future San Diego visitors. We will probably visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “NO FRESH AIR! Totally awful! Food nasty also!”
Reviews.Author: dolldetails
Reviews.Content: $65 a night, assigned to the property from the negotiator-name-your-price website. The staff is prompt and helpful. We were moved to the 14th floor after our heater was broken, which is suppose to be the top, best floor. The place looks shiny and classy. What makes this place rough to deal with is NO WINDOWS open, the door is air-tight probably for noise reasons, and their "heater/AC" pumps in the whiff of burnt kitchen, cigarettes, and whatever other smells. Your skin wakes up dry, and your throat chapped. You will find yourself heaving for air. I have experienced this slightly at other properties, but this has been the worst air-tight-smothering-heaving-for-air experience ever. Such a shame because San Diego is so wonderful and breezy. I know hotels have liability for kids dangling out the windows, but many properties will at least let a guest open the window 2 or 3 inches. I could only imagine a couple getting busy in the sheets what it would be like without air. What a bad idea whoever designed this! Several times we would have to open up the door and try to get fresh oxygen from the hallway. We are in our late 20's and early 30's mind you, not elderly! Such a shame! SOGGY BOUNCY beds! If you like a firm comfy bed, this is not the place! Then the lunch is nasty. Dripping wet lettuce salads. The only soup is cream of Jalapeno. The nachos taste like they came from a sleazy dive bar, smothered in green peppers. The cheese wont melt. Parking is $16 a night Ohhhh and the worse is the grainy television that looks like the 1970s If you are in the front of the property you will face a freeway and mall, the back property faces a cliff. Its pretty and green this time of year, so possibly request that. Hopefully they wont assign us here again.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road....”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times recently. The front desk staff is great. The hotel is older and shows it in places. I stayed on the top "executive" floor and the room was comfortable. The bathroom large. Yes, the fixtures/plumbing/water pressure are always hit and miss. Good location with easy access to 8, shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge with a Hilton Sign - Shamefull”
Reviews.Author: Williz
Reviews.Content: What a disapointment! My wife's employer paid for us to go to San Diego and put us up in this hotel. The room is in need of not only renovation but repair. The cold water tap is falling off. After having a shower there was enough water in the tub to have a bath. There was plastic corner beed hanging off the corners. Impossible to get a proper temperature. We were either freezing or sweating. We had to call for faceclothes because there weren't any after the first day. The Friday night I was awakend numerous times by rowdies in the hall. The saturday night I was awakened by a frenzy of people going down the hall; when I looked out there was a large group of people with what looked like "half the contents of a liquor store" going past our room. This group, a few doors down proceeded to party for the next couple of hours with loud music, slamming doors and yelling. I called the front desk to check into this and after an hour or so it seemed to quiet down. I don't think there was a redeemable quality of this place. I not only will never stay here again I will never stay at a Hilton again. I think that when you stay at certain hotels you go there with a certain set of expectations of quality. This place was a total disapointment. I will say that I have never had a bad experience at the Hampton Inn - an unobvious superior chain to this poorly run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. Rooms and beds were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but still disappoints”
Reviews.Author: darshan s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last month as it was the closest proximity to Zoo,safari and sea world. We booked a room with 2 beds. We were surprised to see the size of the rooms comapared to other Hiltons. Front desk told us that they being a business hotel they just have rooms with either a bed or 2 beds and no bigger suites. So there was no chance we could have got a larger room, even if you are ready to pay a fee. Otherwise the desk and restaurant staff were really helpful. The valet guys were always ready with answers to any questions about the area.Its good for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location to all Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Jay A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 14 floor property located in Mission Valley adjacent to the freeway. It appeals to business travelers but can also be a convenient hotel for all tourist attractions. The rooms are comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: RBfromCO
Reviews.Content: I recently had the chance to stay here while attending a convention near by and my experience was great. When I travel I typically stay at Hilton brands but I do expect a few things so that I want to return in the future. Good service, comfortable and clean rooms, good work space, good excercise room and easy access to my work appointments. This Hilton did a good job in all areas especially service.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: So far the Hilton provided a great stay during my return trip to SD in years. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The rooms are well kept and the staff were very helpful. It was also great having a view of the closeby shopping and restaurant area making it easy to walk rather than to drive just to eat and shop. A recommended must stay. Will stay on my next visit to SD, Recruit Depot and Camp Pendleton. MFMCE53051

Reviews.Title: “Great to be welcomed back”
Reviews.Author: starbean111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last July and came back for a conference and so impressed as the employees at the parking and front desk recognized me and welcomed me back with a big smile so even I am tired from my flight but with the warm welcome I received from the hotel made my day!!! You guys have been great as always~~~

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GBrown442
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton back in May and had a great experience. The Hotel is located around great restaurants and bars. The room service was great as well. The room was also extremely comfortable, was able to get a great night sleep each time. Was a great place to stay on my vacation! Would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Illinifan89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton recently, and have nothing but good things to say. From the comfortable rooms, to the private pool, I loved everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially when it came to finding good restaurants and places to sightsee. Everything I tried at the restaurant in the hotel was delicious as well! I had a great stay at this Hilton and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quickly going down hill”
Reviews.Author: pinkins
Reviews.Content: I am a HH Diamond member and I travel to San Diego many times a year to attend my son's football games. I have done this for several years and the Mission Valley Hilton used to be my choice hotel due to its convenient location to Qualcomm Stadium. I must say though, that the hotel has declined significantly over the last year or so. The little amenities they used to offer such as the refreshing fruit-filled water, free parking, kiosks to print boarding passes, and the free seafood appetizers were what made the hotel stand out from the others for me. However, since they have discontinued all of those amenities I find that there is nothing drawing me back to this hotel. The "superior" rooms consist of nothing more than a bathroom scale and sometimes a refrigerator (which I find annoying because of the constant humming they emanate). The front desk service is passable at best and I always have to remind the staff of what amenities need to be included for HH Diamond members. I have begun staying at the Doubletree in Mission Valley, which is just as convenient to Qualcomm Stadium, and their staff are amazing. The renovated rooms at the Doubletree are beautiful, and although they also charge for parking you can find ample free street parking surrounding the hotel. Given the choice, I would highly recommend staying at the Doubletree over the Mission Valley Hilton. The service, location, rooms, and amenities far exceed the MVH. I find nothing about the MVH that makes it stand out any longer. If you're looking for an average hotel at an above-average price then you will be fine at this hotel. However, if you like a little something extra for your money then I wouldn't bother staying here. Personally, I have canceled all of my future stays here and moved to the Doubletree in Mission Valey.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, run down, Ok Location”
Reviews.Author: halleybopp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about $140 a night during the summer, and parking was an extra $16 a day. The rooms were old and dirty. For a fashionable town like San Diego, this place is especially run down. The location is OK, close to downtown and the airport, but far from the beaches and tourist attractions. I would probably not stay here again unless the price dropped. I think you can find much better hotels for your money in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atamel
Reviews.Content: This is just an average hotel. Its located just outside downtown San Diego without much public transportation around, so you definitely need a car. It's close to Gas Lamp district (10-15 min drive) if you like going out and a mall nearby for shoppers. Parking is $16 per night which is a little pricey for a place outside downtown. Rooms are nice and clean. No free internet. I think there's a pool but I didn't try so I can't comment. There was a bar as well but it seemed dead so I didn't try it either.

Reviews.Title: “If you have small children, be prepared to pay for a refigerator to keep their formula/ milk cold.”
Reviews.Author: Monix007
Reviews.Content: First off, I have stayed at several Hilton Hotels, and this one is the worst. This hotel charges for every single thing! They have ample self parking and it's $16 per day or $20 for valet. If you want a fridge (shouldn't it be standard at "Hilton" hotel?) it is $10 per day. If you have small children, be prepared to pay for a refigerator to keep their formula/ milk cold. There is free wifi in the lobby, but if you want to use the Internet at the convenience in your own room, there is also a charge for that. The night staff was appropriate, but they weren't accommodating enough to provide customer satisfaction. So after spending three nights here, my total alone for the extra amenities without tax was $78(not including wifi and tax). One would assume that if you're paying $129 plus tax a night for a three in a half or four star hotel, parking, refrigerator, and wifi in the room would be included. I guess not for this Hilton. Next time I'll be sure to read the fine print of amenities included, but for sure, I will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Green Option”
Reviews.Author: btaira
Reviews.Content: I applaude the Hilton San Diego Mission Valley's program that allows you to choose a "Green opt-out option" of room service in exchange for a $5 credit (donation to Susan G. Komen, restaurant credit or gift card). It is a great program that I would like to see propagated throughout the Hilton line and other hotel chains!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Put This Hotel in the"Very Good" Category”
Reviews.Author: richardbett
Reviews.Content: If the entire hotel was like the lobby and the hotel staff, this would be a "very good" hotel. The lobby looks like a four star hotel & I will admit the customer service here is superb, but the rest of the hotel is very plain for the Hilton chain. Like all other comments on here, the parking is a negative...seems like the norm in the San Diego area to pay a premium for parking. It's kind of a joke, but a way for the hotel to recoup money. The pool area seems to be an afterthought. It is stuck on the side of the hotel and basically away from the entire hotel. The rooms were plain. The key readers and doors were very dated, not too far removed from the old key entry doors. Overall, if you get a deal on this hotel on Priceline, great, otherwise I wouldn't pay the Hilton advertised price.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: cmsteib
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, bed was very comfortable. Friendly staff. Good variety of food at breakfast buffet. Avoided the $16/day parking screw over by parking free on street. Just a short walk, so well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suethestew
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Mission Valley is a great hotel, from the accomodating staff to the cleanliness of the hotel and rooms. We were in town for the Vikings/Chargers game and found the location to be perfect! There are so many restaurants and shopping and attractions in the area. Felt like a very safe location. I would highly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelhopper3
Reviews.Content: The positives: it's location isn't bad, the rooms were nice, big tv. The negatives: parking is $16 a day, the location is only accesable using a secondary road and it's a little hard to figure out how to get there. The bathroom could use an upgrade and the rooms are a little small. the pocket door in the bathroom is a little weird and has atiny handle.Internet is $10 a day. I had a room with an adjoining room door in it. Too much noise (voices and TV)came through the door and light came under the door from a large gap. Water noises from other rooms was annoying(Shower running, Toilet flushing).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Expierence”
Reviews.Author: morenoconsulting
Reviews.Content: Great staff expierence from arrival to departure. Staff anticiapted my needs throughout my stay. Very close to all great San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ausspunky
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at this hotel twice. each time the hotel staff, including the bar staff were wonderful. room was always clean. i do agree the cost for parking is high but majority hotels charge the same rate or higher. i will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the weather”
Reviews.Author: efandb1
Reviews.Content: Conveinient to Old Town,Gaslamp,Zoo. Friendly staff. Decent rooms.Close to airport.Fortunately had a Priceline deal on room..$16.00 a day to park for a hotel guest is a little over the top.Would I stay here again yes,no,maybe.Also $9.00 for a drink (call brand) in the bar is really expensive,but,if u have to look at the prices you should not be there.Oh,yes Petco for baseball fans is BEAUTIFUL! as is all the above listed attractions.San Diego Zoo..the best BUT $40.00 to get in and worth it.Oh yes,hotel staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About This One”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuy47
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this place. I was here on business and held two events at the hotel. The sales manager was difficult to deal with and didn't pay attention to the details of our event. When confronted with the neglected arrangements, she was reluctant to correct them. Parking can be a problem, too... and they charge more than they should. Although they offered a discount, it was still too much to charge for an event at their hotel. And overnight guests get charged something like $14 for in/out privileges... also too much. Guest rooms are pretty standard. Views on the back side of the hotel are a hill and trash dumpsters. Public spaces are pretty ordinary, as is the restaurant/bar. As far as Hilton properties in the Mission Valley area go, I actually prefer the Doubletree (the one on Hazard Center Drive, NOT the one on Hotel Circle South) -- it's not quite as easy to get to, but there are restaurants/shops within walking distance and it just seems cleaner and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip”
Reviews.Author: pearl56
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. I would rent a car taxi to high! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brnxslices
Reviews.Content: Hilton at Mission Valley was in a good location and good clean rooms. The food at restaurant inside was not the best and a little pricey. Also $16 a day to park.

Reviews.Title: “Trifecta! Great Staff, Rooms and Location”
Reviews.Author: Jesse B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a vacation to San Diego and found the Hilton Mission Valley to be a great hotel in terms of service, comfortableness and location. From the time we pulled up until checkout the entire staff we came across from the Bellmen (great restaurant recs) to the Front Desk were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very comfortable, clean (even for my wife;) and quiet (a must for me). The location is great if you want a centralized location to access many of the great activities San Diego offers and of course there is tons of nearby shopping. Great job to the staff once again, we really had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU BRING A CAR TO THIS HOTEL -- USE SELF PARKING”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hilton Mission Valley in July on business. I drove from LA and the Hotel's location was very convenient to the freeways. My room was clean and comfortable. The maid service was excellent. The restaurant food was average and service was a bit slow (room service was actually faster) but that didn't bother me because there are lots of great restaurants nearby. The Hilton gift shop was a pleasant surprise. It carried a lot of things I didn't expect and has a friendly staff. The business center was adequate. I was able to print documents, make copies and send a fax. There is also a Kinko's about three miles away (for color copies). There is a daily charge for internet. I did not try the pool or fitness center, so I cannot comment on those amenities. The front desk recommended valet parking. I used my car twice during my stay. The first time, I was in and out without a hitch. The second time they couldn't find my car keys. It took them more than 30 minutes to finally locate my keys, but I did not complain. I didn't use my car again until I checked out. I was due to check out Wednesday morning, but decided to leave late Tuesday night instead. I packed my car and was happy to be returning home. As I began to drive away, I noticed that my seat and steering wheel had been moved - not a big deal. Then I saw that my radio was tuned to Sirius (which I had cancelled). It was dark and I was having trouble seeing. Then I realized my automatic lights had been shut off. There I was driving on Route 15 at night in traffic without lights. Why would someone do that? The valet service ruined an otherwise enjoyable stay at the Hilton Mission Valley. I will not be staying there again. If you stay there and bring a car, my advice is to use self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back.”
Reviews.Author: Seedling17
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel primarily for the location and the Sea World & Zoo ticket deal was also attractive. Having just stayed in a very large suite in Las Vegas, I have to say the room felt very small. There were 2 beds, I would say doubles rather than Queens. There was very little drawer space to put our clothes and overall it felt very pokey. On the plus side the room was clean and the location was ideal, just minutes from Seaworld and the zoo. dont agree with the fairly high parking charge though. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JTVohana
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Room size adequete but seemed smaller than other Hilton properties. Steady drone of trafffic noise from Interstate 8 which the hotel overlooks. Furnishings/bath OK but nothing particularly posh. Bed not bad but less comfortable than some of the signature beds at Hilton Garden or Doubletree. No concierge lounge for Honors Diamonds, you get a coupon for the breakfast buffet (pretty good) and an apetizer for dinner. Overall an OK choice if you must stay at Hotel Circle..but there are many better Hilton brand choices in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Brian_RapidCity
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to San Diego and stayed at the Hilton Mission Valley after a successful bid on Priceline. The room was average for a hotel of similar quality, but we were disappointed with the $14 per day parking and $10 per day internet. For a $80 successful bid on Priceline, an extra $25 per night was ridiculous. In addition, the restaurant (Stish) is overpriced when compared to the restaurants surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad management! Shame to Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNoncall
Reviews.Content: NO AIRCONDiTION on my room! And supposedly it is not. Enough reason for them to transfer me! So what, if you dont have available room? You have to compensate better for your flaw! The rate i paid is for a room with A/C not with a fan. Since you are not meeting the expectation, you should do something abt it! I was sweating!!!in a Hilton Hotel! My car is even cooler than the room! Very bad management! I didnt come here for the food so no need to offer the breakfast! I paid for a nice room not a room with MAlFUnCtIon aircondition and a NOISY electric fan! So demeaning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay..but poor location if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: Rooms felt a bit outdated and coffeepot was dirty and not usable, you can't really walk to anything from the hotel so unless you have a car, not a great location. Service was friendly though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, but What's with the Internet?”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Kenobi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Hilton San Diego Mission Valley. I stayed with some friends and attended Comic Con. This hotel was terrific. The service was friendly and prompt. They don't have refrigerators in the room, but for $10 per day, you can rent one. No problem. The only issue I had with the hotel was their internet service. I have 3G, and I turned my WiFi off, so why couldn't I use my internet in the hotel? I was paying for the internet through my server, not the Hilton, so I should have been able to use it no problem. It was a problem. The first few nights I was able to log onto my phone and surf the net, check Facebook, etc. but after that, I kept getting the Hilton homepage where I would have to pay for internet. Why? I turned off my WiFi. I pay for my own internet. It was like they were interfering with my internet so I would have to pay for their WiFi. Other than that, the hotel was great. We booked through the Comic Con hotel reservations, and so we didn't get so lucky with the location. If you are going to Sea World, this is the hotel to get. And the location is perfect for airport transfer. Although we got lost on the way to the airport....shoddy GPS kept leading us to the Area 51 looking section of the airport. Hmmm. But if you are looking for a hotel for next year's Comic Con, or anything else near the convention center or Gaslamp district, this is not your hotel. It was 1/2 hour to 45 minutes to get to the Convention each day. All in all, the hotel was very good. I recommend staying here if you are going to Sea World, or other San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: teambart
Reviews.Content: Hilton in Mission Valley is my second home away from home. Very accessible to freeways and shopping malls and restaurants. The hotel is clean and staff are always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely we'll come back”
Reviews.Author: starbean111
Reviews.Content: Came here to San Diego to meet my high school friends.. this Hilton has the perfect location for family very close to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo and tons of restaurants to choose from.... we'll sure come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: denisi11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business purposes, there is a mall accross the street with a number of eateries, right off the freeway which makes getting around quite easy, I was working in Chula Vista and it was only a fifteen minute drive, not bad. Several attractions are a small drive away. The hotel is very clean; I felt welcome and safe, very important as I was traveling alone. The hotel is not on a particularly beautiful area of town, but the location and convenience makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Humble”
Reviews.Author: mistermark8
Reviews.Content: One of the older Hiltons in San Diego, it has a great central location in the valley and much lower rates than the new Hilton by the bay. I booked this hotel for some friends out of town and it is a quiet beautiful hotel. The rooms are standard size and the decor makes it seem more spacious than it really is. I suggest this hotel if people want a good quality brand at a lower price and a good central location in the middle of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Quiet. Great Location. I Would Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: Drum4JC
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous having a room overlooking the freeway, but the room was very quiet. The staff was friendly and courteous. The central location is a big plus. It took only a few minutes to get to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “do not deserve the Hilton name”
Reviews.Author: botticini
Reviews.Content: we stayed there from june22tojune30, 2011 the Front Desk's people are unpolite and rude, the room was small, noisy,and a non smoking room smelled cigarrette, the bathroom with the shower that did not have a regular hot water. The Hilton had to change a lot of things

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dnfreelance
Reviews.Content: We recently held a family reunion in San Diego and based our activities out of the hotel. Our room was very clean and the staff professional and accommodating. The food and service in the restaurant was very good. A hugh "Thank You" to Matthew Baker, Director of Sales and Marketing for making our stay a memorable experience. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Pella96
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff very nice and accommodating. The rooms were spacious and housekeeping was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice if you want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: azmom99
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 2 nights over the Fourth of July holiday and we paid $80 a night on Priceline. Self-parking at this hotel is $14 a night. The bathroom was clean and big enough but the toilet was tipped to the side which made everyone feel like they were falling off of it. The bathroom also had a pocket door which was very noisy and hard to open and close. The beds are double beds. The sheets and mattress were fine, but with the beds being so small it was hard to get comfortable. The room had a flat screen tv, but everything else was pretty dated. The room appeared clean enough with the exception of several fairly large red stains on the carpet. I didn't bother to look close enough to try and figure out what it was. As mentioned in other reviews, the walls are extremely thin. We could hear even the slightest sounds coming from the other rooms. We stayed on the side away from the freeway so we didn't hear any freeway noise. The a/c didn't work too well, so the room was pretty warm most of the time. Housekeeping did bring us extra towels quickly when we requested them, but when we came back to the room after they had cleaned, they left the toilet paper roll bar on the sink with no toilet paper anywhere to be found. The first night we all wanted to go to sleep early as we were getting up early the next day. We heard very loud music, but figured it would end soon. It didn't. At 11:00 pm my husband finally went down to the lobby to complain. Turns out that the hotel had rented out a ballroom on the first floor to a very large Salsa party group. We were on the 8th floor and couldn't believe how loud it was. The front desk apologized but told him the party would be going until 1:00 am. When he got back to the room and told me what was going on, I called down to the lobby myself to complain and I was told that the party group rented a room just like we did so they could do what they wished. I was also told that I could check out if it bothered me. With 2 kids at 11:30 at night, that is not an option. Since I had used Priceline the only comp I could get was parking so I asked for that, the employee comped the parking and then hung up on me. Needless to say, we didn't get a good night's sleep at all. We have stayed at many Hilton's throughout the country, and this one is definitely not up to the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Family visit”
Reviews.Author: steelbender
Reviews.Content: The hotel was near the freeway for easy access but we couldn't hear it from our room. Walking down a block allowed crossing the overpass and put us in the parking lot of the Mission Valley Mall. We spent several hours a day at the mall since they had meals and movies. It was easy for family to meet us there after they got off work. The hotel was comfortable and clean. The breakfast at the hotel had a good selection and custom omlets were included. The outdoor pool and hot tub area had ample space for lounge chairs. It was a great place to just rest.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the way”
Reviews.Author: Guamstile
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mission Valley Hilton while visiting family in San Diego. When booking my room in "Hotel Circle" I kept my expectations moderate as I have stayed in teh area before and it tends to be chaotic and a tourist factory. However, I must say, from the moment we pulled up to the Mission Valley Hilton, we were greeted warmly and once we were inside the hotel it was everythihg but chaotic and impersonal. The decor and ambiance was very nice and we felt like we were in San Diego. The staff was great, the rooms were ultra modern and what food we had there, was quality. From now on, when I come to San Diego, I am staying here. You get all the convinience of Mission Valley, with an escape in the hotel. I highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: nlculp31784
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again. The beds were barely bigger than a twin. The guest services dept. were unwelcoming and rude. The fees for self parking were outrageous. FYI If you are using a debit card for incidentals expect a $75 per night/per room charge to your card that takes over a week to refund after check out. The internet fees were high., The restaurant was unsatisfactory, inferior to that of Denny's. The booths were ripped, stained and dirty. Very unhappy with the overall stay. There are many hotels to choose from with competitive rates. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The pool was comparable to a motel 6 pool... nothing special and no towel service. The house keeping was less than satisfactory, they made the beds, that’s about it. The walls are paper thin, we heard everything from rolling suitcases/service carts to doors opening and closing at all hours of the night. Don't stay here... it's over priced and extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sarahdsmom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Hotwire for under $100. It's in a very central area of San Diego, you are within about 15 to 20 minutes drive to beaches, bay and Sea World or the Zoo. There is a mall with restaurants and a theater across the freeway, you could walk it but I would drive as it's a very congested area. Brandon at the front desk was very accommodating in finding me a quiet room at the end of a hall. The view was of the hill behind us but wasn't an issue for us. Every staff person we passed during our stay greeted us with a smile. The parking is below the hotel and does cost money but this is true of most hotels in the Valley. I never felt unsafe in the underground parking at all as there are cameras. If you have someone visiting you, to avoid the $3 and hour parking fee (up to $12) have them park on the street in front of the jeep dealer or farther down. The bar and restaurant here area excellent, great service and good food and drinks...not a weak one was poured during our stay! If you put out the "being green" door hanger to say you don't need towels & sheets laundered that day, they give you a $5 off certificate to use at the restaurant or gift shop, great deal! The pool & spa area were clean and plenty of towels were on hand.The only thing I would wish for is a fridge and microwave in the room, there was room for it so I'm not sure if you asked for one if they couldn't accommodate you. There is free wifi but only in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: luvatl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite here several months back and we definitely enjoyed it! My son and niece enjoyed having their own little separate room with bunk beds and a table and chairs. The room was very clean when we arrived. That is one of the main things I look for in a hotel. The wifi connection was also good. The location was great. Close to everything on our to do list. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby too. The cookies of course are delicious! The only downside is the parking charges. Expensive, but a lot of hotels in San Diego charge for this. Some even more. The hotel is up on a hill also so you have to be extremely careful coming in and out in the car. If you have a low car or even a normal sedan, it may scrape the bottom. One more thing, please avoid Adam's Steak and Eggs at all costs. Not only was it extremely expansive, the food and service were horrible. Not sure which was worse.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BridesMom2AJ
Reviews.Content: We just hosted our daughters wedding at the Mission Valley Hilton. All I can say is that it was wonderful and we couldn't have been more pleased with all that was provided. Our out of town guests commented on the perfect location to the airport and San Diego attractions. The employees were amazing and went above and beyond all our expectations. The dinner at the reception and the breakfast the next day were very good. Our rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. The upstairs ballroom looked beautiful and the outside balcony was a nice place to cool down or chat quietly after the wild dancing. I would highly recommend this hotel and "Amy" as your planner for anyone who is planning a wedding. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Ever (at this hotel)”
Reviews.Author: ichthyophile
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time at this beautiful venue. The staff was kind and very patient. Loved the Peter Thomas Roth products. Food was fresh, tasty and served quickly. Pool was not stunning, but kept at the perfect temperature. Beds and pillows were super comfy! Thanks for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “I love the customer service!”
Reviews.Author: victormontoya
Reviews.Content: I recently visited your hotel and I am very happy with your customer service. Everyone was great but I would like to highlight Tania Alvarez who was an excellent bar tender. She was very fun to talk to and an asset to your business. I want to thank everyone at the hotel and keep it up! Victor M.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Friendly Staff, Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: firefly2580
Reviews.Content: My company held our national meeting here and was met with great service levels, organized and accommodating staff and well appointed rooms and meeting areas. What a great experience. We will definitely return. Whatever we needed they made it happen. It is nice to know that a hotel wants your business and provides what you need as a customer with no stuffiness.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and close to the zoo”
Reviews.Author: paleomatt
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonable place to stay that offers spacious and clean rooms near the San Diego Zoo, this Hilton is probably a good choice. The staff were perfectly friendly and the facilities are nice. They were offering free iced lemonade in the lobby when we arrived and that was a lovely touch. Also, as a Hilton Silver member I was treated to a free appetizer in the restaurant - we ordered the nachos and this turned out to be large enough to a single meal for two to share! (of course, we were visiting from Europe where meals are universally smaller, so perhaps the nachos would function as just an appetiser to a large American). Parking fees are stiff and the Hilton should be ashamed of itself for charging so much but that is the only major negative. We tried to use the jacuzzi one evening but it was so crammed full of people we gave this a miss. I don't think this was because the jacuzzi was small but rather because there just happened to be a lot of people visiting it at the time.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton is costlier than you would think and not so accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: ReadgSpellgTutor
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hilton Mission Valley SanDiego was such a bad priceline experience. Glad I didn't pay full price. Altho' they say it is a 3.5 star, in order to get everything you need, you might as well go to a 4star and pay rack rate. Everything extra cost money including microwave, fridge, internet, parking, etc. Between $14-15 EACH. I pd $70 plus taxes without a fridge/microwave/internet/parking/breakfast. They did give a free newspaper in the a.m. I asked twice to have tub drain taken care of, first backed up to 3 in., then after next complaint, backed up to 2 inches. After next complaint, it still didn't work so decided not to shower. They comp’ed me 3 days of parking about $40...would have rather showered. We had to request hand towels and coffee after the first day, because the maid didn’t replace them. What a horrible experience, especially because I was down there to make arrangements for my brother, who had passed away. I am petrified of dogs and they were having a dog convention at the hotel, so there were dogs and their owners allll over, in the elevators, lobby, halls. It was horrorendous. We left a day early due to another brother’s illness, and gave Priceline the Drs. Contact and info, Priceline contacted the hotel to see if they would refund the money for checking out one day early, and the hotel declined. We checked out about 9a.m. so they probably rerented the room. Considering the trouble with the tub and missing items in the room, plus it was due to illness, I would think they would have made an exception and given a refund for the night we didn’t stay. A little low on the marketing side. Hiltons have really gone to the dogs! Literally! By the way, I sent this info to corporate Hilton after I received an email asking for my opinion but nobody has contacted in over a week , so so decided I’d better let others know. The desk staff were really nice and the lobby is gorgeous. The location next to a mall, freeway, and eateries is good. Another plus, they haven’t been reported in the bedbugregistry.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lajb
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant about this hotel after reading some reviews but I was totally impressed. The hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and updated, the beds were comfortable. We were not on the side facing the freeway so the room was very quiet. We booked a package that included breakfast for two which was great. It was buffet style but you could have a custom made omelet or waffle, and staff served your beverages at your table. The hotel was less than 10 minutes from Sea World and also had a shopping center and restaurants right across the freeway. Would definitely stay there again when in San Diego! Only downside was cost for parking and cost of wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing Hilton about this hotel is their name.”
Reviews.Author: Vinsured
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and i've never been more unimpressed by a Hilton then this property. The lobby is nice, but you can't stay in it for more then 5 seconds without the automatic doors opening and a rush of cold windy air running in.. The Restaurant and bar are freezing too. With my Hilton Honors level, I would normally recieve an upgrade the the Executive floor, but guess what they don't have one. So to make up for this you get nada. The room is clean, but dated and old except for the TV. The sheets are very nice, so you sleep well in a room that smells musty and sounds like a freeway right next to you...oh wait, it is right next to you. No Refrigerators, flimsly wicker chair, and poor water pressure. The good news is the parking is easy to get to and it's right next to the hotel, the bad news is they will charge you $14 for the honor of parking there. Also there is nothing around the hotel, except an AM/PM, a car dealership and two closed places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed with this one...”
Reviews.Author: sunshine01630163
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed immediately after pulling up to the hotel when the doorman informed me that I could park in the self-serve lot for $14 a day or valet for $18. Hmm... pay to park my own car. Not impressed. Checking in was painless and the hostess was really polite. My room "appeared" clean when I entered. But after turning on the bathroom light, I noticed A LOT of hair on the floor. EWWWW!!! NOT IMPRESSED. Seriously?! They didn't even sweep the floor (forget about mopping). Made me wonder what else they didn't do when cleaning my room. I will NOT be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience for a Diamond Hilton Member”
Reviews.Author: JSMPhilly
Reviews.Content: Being loyal to the Hilton brand of hotels has been easy until I stayed at this hotel. I have been a Diamond member with Hilton for the past four years (over 600 nights total). This is by far the worst hotel in the Hilton chain, the hotel is not renovated (the gym is in the laundry room) as someone claimed in their review, and the "restaurant" is far from the Hilton standard. It took 3 tries before the front desk could find a room that had actually been prepared for a guest to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: discusdoc
Reviews.Content: This is advertised as an up-scale business hotel. They charge extra for parking and Internet (high fees), they are located 100 yard from a busy freeway, and their restaurant is terrible. I had to sleep diagonally on their king-size bed (I'm 6-4). Bed size is usually not a problem in other up-scale hotels. I do not recommend the Mission Valley Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: ROARR
Reviews.Content: I'm a seasoned Hilton property traveler and have stayed at many of their proporties across the country. I have yet to receive the service and hospitality like I did at the San Diego Mission Valley Hilton. From the valets, to the front desk, to the servers at the restaurant, and even the bartender. This place has its act together in every sense. I have never felt more welcome or appreciated to be a customer. The food at the restaurant was outstanding. My evening meals were perfectly prepared and tasted wonderful. The breakfast buffet had everything you could want. They would even prepare eggs to your liking if you prefered. If you're ready for a beautifully renovated Hilton and service at every corner, I highly recommend you give this place some consideration. Free WiFi didn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, loved it”
Reviews.Author: bob1111111
Reviews.Content: I had heard that Mission Valley wasn't that great but I was plesantly surprised with the Hilton Mission Valley. The rooms were pretty standard for a Hilton but the staff was very helpful, the free appitizers for HH guests were huge and the free breakfasts for HH members were excellent. My wife enjoyed the pool and the fitness facility and was able to do a little laundry while there since the washer/dryers are in the fitness room. Also the location turned out to be right in the middle of lots of restraunts and shopping. All around it's a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mango54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a good location. The bath & hand towels are old and shabby. I can't believe this hotel does not offer free Wi-Fi. Overall, good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of oddities but better then expected for the money”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone... My three fave places in the SD were totally booked..BUMMER.. I decided to take a risk on Hotwire...I am not usually a fan of the Mission Valley area but it worked out this time... Room was basic and clean. $70 priceline bid...which saved about 30 bucks a night. I wish they had a little couch/nicer sitting option...You can upgrade to an executive room for $10 which gets you a baby fridge...The room was fine but the doors should be thicker...I could hear the people walking by my room like crazy...luckily I sleep pretty heavily... There underground parking set up is a little odd...Also the visitor daily parking max is $12, but guest daily max is $14...shouldn't i just say I am a guest then? On the plus side I discovered the Gordon Bierch Brewery which is very close and has an excellent meal there! Thanks to my local friend you did the recommend..One of the nights I went out to dinner at the Fashion Valley Cheesecake Factory...

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jaegis
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and convenient, this hotel is located near I8, I5 and RT 163 which gives access from downtown San Diego to Balboa Park to Seaworld to Mission Bay and to La Jolla. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The "electron concierge" gave lots of information on local attractions. The beds were comfortable, the rooms and bathrooms were large enough. This hotel is not a spa/destination hotel. Its fitness room is adequate and not busy. The pool is small. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, but not up to Hilton Quality”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at this hotel with my wife and two tweens. Its an "OK" hotel but nothing special and I'd go elsewhere if I were to return to that area. The room was average size but the dresser/TV stand was pitifully small looked very "cheap". One of the closet doors was broken and couldn't be opened, the drawer cover in the bathroom was crooked and wouldn't shut. The clock in the room had the wrong time and even though we were there for 4 nights and told them we were 4 in the rooms, we had to repeatable ask them for extra towels because the cleaning staff would only leave 3 towels all the time. Its close to a major shopping district and a lot of restaurants which was nice, its also a short drive to get to all the major attractions (less than 15 minutes to get anywhere). The price was reasonable but when you add $14/day parking and $10/day for internet access, it wasn't what I'd consider a "good deal", just an average cost. They have a pool which is a decent size but your right along the highway so theres a lot of noise when your outside. On the plus side though, we asked for a quiet room and it absolutely was, we couldn't hear anybodys TV or talking in adjacent rooms. Beware though, they seem to have a lot of celebrations on the 2nd floor and we were warned that the 3rd floor would be noisy, so keep that in mind if you go. They also have a fitness center, but its very small (one elliptical and one treadmill which happened to be broken when we went. I didn't "hate" my stay or anything but I expected a nicer room for a Hilton hotel. I'd

Reviews.Title: “A bargain, but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: benzz
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of benefits to staying in Mission Valley....it's equidistant from both downtown and SeaWorld, and it's only a couple of minutes away from the Fashion Valley shopping center...plus, room rates tend to be much lower than staying in the Gaslamp or near Mission Bay. We picked the Hilton for our stay, since the $120/night rate (including breakfast) was the lowest in the area for our last-minute weekend visit. Everything started out nice; they had a room ready for us even though we arrived at the hotel at 10am, and our HHonors status meant that our in-room internet was free. The room looked nice enough at first glance...it had clearly been recently renovated, with the only pre-renovation residue being the aging tile work in the shower. But this Hilton isn't in the same league as its sister hotels downtown and near SeaWorld. For starters, even though our room was on the 12th floor, the roar from the freeway outside was constant and overbearing, even in the middle of the night. Upon closer inspection, the culprit is the windows themselves....I've never seen windows that thin in a hotel or even a private home...they're about half as thick as standard single-pane glass. But noise isn't the only thing that gets in...the drapes do virtually nothing to block light from entering the room (see attached pic), which made falling asleep rather difficult. Light and sound also enters the room thru the thin interior walls (the sounds of showers and sinks upstairs occasionally drowned out the traffic noise) and thru the door to the room itself, which had a gap large enough for a finger. Noise wasn't my only gripe, however...the water pressure in our room was awful, the food at the breakfast buffet was so bad (even for a freebie) we went elsewhere after our first morning, and the 12th floor hallway reeked of cigarette smoke. Plus, $14/day for parking is unacceptable to me in a suburban hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: FargoJim
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient to the freeway, so it is easy to get out in the morning and get to your next destination. It's not far from the city. However, it is in a funky area next to several car dealerships. There is nothing scenic or touristy within walking distance. That’s okay if you plan to just sleep there and then hit the road. Not great for vacation or family stuff. I try to keep up with my fitness program when I’m on the road, so I was disappointed to see that the fitness facility had outdated, run down equipment. It also shares space with the laundry room. If you love working out with a washer and dryer running next to you this is the place to be. Some of the equipment appears to be early 90s era and the displays are kind of rotted off. Also there is one TV in the fitness center, no individual monitors, so you better like what’s on.
